segments.text: I notice the little boy standing on that wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s stretching so far, and the stool looks like it’s about to tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is right there, waiting for him to hand her a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how reckless they’re being, and the woman at the sink has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is already tilted, and he’s not even holding on to anything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they’re going to end up in a heap on the floor if he doesn’t get down soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so hopeful, but she doesn’t seem to realize the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ve done this before and gotten away with it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water from the sink is getting closer to them, and the floor is already slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they grab those cookies and get down before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR
